purpose: Guide users through a clear, stress-free registration process that explains the user-beneficiary relationship and collects necessary information without overwhelming them

current_problems: Step 1 contains 95% of the entire form - massive cognitive overload
All user info + optional beneficiary info crammed into one endless scroll
Document uploads (photo + selfie) mixed in with basic fields
Password fields awkwardly placed in the middle of the form
Beneficiary toggle is vague - 'Para beneficiário?' doesn't explain the relationship
No visual guidance or illustrations to reduce form anxiety
Stepper shows 3 steps but only Step 1 has real work
Conditional fields appear/disappear abruptly without smooth transitions
No clear explanation of WHY we need certain information
Success screen is plain and doesn't celebrate completion
No review step before final submission
Maximum 3 beneficiaries only mentioned in button text
ux_flaws: Users don't understand usuario → beneficiario relationship upfront
No progress indication within the massive Step 1
Too many decisions at once (toggle switches, add/remove buttons, conditional fields)
Document upload section has no visual examples or guidance
No way to save progress and come back later
Error messages appear far from their input fields on long forms
Users can't review all entered data before submitting
No clear value proposition - why should users complete this lengthy process?
Special needs section feels clinical and impersonal
School-age toggle doesn't auto-detect based on age
ui_inconsistencies: Generic shadcn cards without custom branding
Beneficiary cards use muted background (looks like disabled state)
File upload components lack personality and guidance
No consistent spacing between form sections
Switch components look too technical for general audience
No visual differentiation between primary user and beneficiaries
Terms screen is text-heavy with no visual breaks

design_strategy.visual_identity: Warm, welcoming flat design with purple (#5B21B6) as primary, coral (#FB7185) for CTAs, and cream (#FFF7ED) backgrounds. Each step gets a custom flat illustration that explains what information is being collected and why. Use friendly, conversational copy throughout.
design_strategy.layout_approach: Multi-step wizard with clear progress indication. Break the form into 7 logical steps: (1) Terms, (2) Your Info, (3) Your Documents, (4) Beneficiary Decision, (5) Beneficiary Details (if yes), (6) Review & Confirm, (7) Success. Each step fits within one viewport (minimal scrolling).
design_strategy.component_hierarchy: Illustration at top → Step title → Friendly explanation → Form fields → Navigation buttons at bottom. Maximum 5 input fields per step to reduce cognitive load.
design_strategy.usuario_beneficiario_explanation: Add an explainer card at the start: 'Você está cadastrando sua conta como USUÁRIO. Você pode adicionar BENEFICIÁRIOS (pessoas que receberão as aulas) durante ou após este cadastro.' Use simple icons to show the relationship.
design_strategy.illustration_strategy: 7 custom flat illustrations: (1) Document/checkmark for terms, (2) Person icon for user info, (3) ID card + camera for documents, (4) Two people icons for beneficiary decision, (5) Child with backpack for beneficiary details, (6) Checklist for review, (7) Celebration for success.
design_strategy.mobile_differences: Same step structure but with: Full-screen steps (no sidebar stepper), swipe gestures between steps, native file picker integration, larger touch targets (min 48px), floating bottom navigation bar, progress bar at top.

desktop_structure.global_layout: Centered container with left sidebar showing vertical stepper, main content area on right

notes_for_dev: Break current single-step form into 7 separate step components for better maintainability
Use React Hook Form with Zod for validation (keep existing schemas, split by step)
Store form state in context or parent component state to preserve data across steps
Implement stepper component with dynamic step completion tracking
Step 4 (Beneficiary Details) should be SKIPPED entirely if user chose 'Adicionar depois'
Use Framer Motion for smooth page transitions between steps (slide animations)
File upload: Use react-dropzone for drag-and-drop, show preview thumbnails
Mobile: Implement swipe gesture library (react-swipeable) for step navigation
Review step (Step 5) should allow 'Edit' links that navigate back to specific steps while preserving data
Add progress persistence in localStorage (optional) to allow users to resume if they close the browser
Conditional fields should use smooth fade-in animations (animate-in from shadcn)
Password strength indicator can be added (optional) with color-coded bar
Terms acceptance checkbox must block Next button until checked
Final submit button in Step 5 should show loading state with spinner
Success step should auto-redirect to dashboard after 5 seconds (with countdown)
All illustrations should be SVG with proper alt text for accessibility
Use lazy loading for illustrations to improve initial page load time
Mobile navigation bar should be position:sticky, bottom:0 with safe-area-inset for iOS notch
Implement form autosave (debounced) to localStorage every 30 seconds
Add analytics tracking for step completion rates and abandonment points
performance_considerations: Lazy load step components (only load current step + next step)
Optimize illustrations (SVGO for SVGs, WebP for rasters)
Debounce validation to avoid excessive re-renders
Use React.memo for beneficiary cards to prevent unnecessary re-renders
Implement virtual scrolling for long select dropdowns (grade levels)
Compress uploaded images client-side before sending to server
Total registration flow: <2MB including all assets
